page.title: 05THE VILLAGE OF CHARLTON
page.content: Charlton is a very small hamlet, situated at the end of a no through road.It relies on its neighbour, Creech Heathfield,for many amenities. Creech Heathfield provides a doctor and a policeman but,sadly missed by the people of Charlton is a resident nurse.They can use the clubs that are run by their neighbouring village. Examples are the Women's Institute, Scouts,Over 60's and a Photographic Club. Except for one businessman,who has bought Charlton Manor,all the residents of Charlton are employed locally,working their own or a neighbour's land.On one farm they keep Jersey cows and chickens.Another farmer has changed from dairy farming to cereal growing and now also breeds pheasants.Charlton Orchards is the other farming enterprise.
